Title: UX Developer - Smithfield, RI 02917 - Indeed.com
Description:
Fidelity TalentSource is your destination for discovering your next temporary role at Fidelity Investments. 
 We are currently sourcing for a UX Developer to work in Smithfield, Rhode Island, Merrimack, New Hampshire or Jersey City, New Jersey, or Durham, North Carolina, or Westlake, Texas. 
 The Role 
 The Fidelity Labs team are building out a new track that will need an experienced Principal UX Engineer in Ireland to develop innovative, scalable, highly interactive and engaging applications. Working closely with a team of UX designers, full-stack developers, data scientists, and research specialists who will value your expertise in software engineering and deep understanding of the latest web technologies and frameworks. Our team is highly collaborative, but equally values heads-down time to implement and deliver. Key work items include moving from storyboards and wireframes to implementing our new React application. The ideal candidate is a hard-working front-end web developer with an appetite for learning, keeping up with the latest industry trends, an eye for user-centered design, and proven ability building web applications. 
 Work closely with the Agile team members to drive the team's commitments to quality 
 Converting UI/UX design specifications into functional web interactions 
 Design, implement, and own adaptable, scalable, performant, and robust web applications that will run across browsers from mobile to desktop 
 Support production software operations, test and debug programs 
 Quality inspections of test and development artifacts within the team 
 Track issues and work within the agile team to identify root causes 
 Report progress and status of work you're leading to project teams and managers 
 
 The Expertise and Skills You Bring 
 Experienced with REACT 
 Experienced with JavaScript and the programming paradigms it supports 
 Experienced with TypeScript and associated concepts 
 Understanding of REST APIs, API Use Patterns 
 Experienced/Exposure to Angular (or similar) 
 Expert/Exposure with React Testing Library and/or Test Driven Development (TDD) (or similar) 
 Expert/Exposure to Axios, React, Redux, Reach Hooks, Redux Thunk, Redux-Saga and Material-UI (Or similar) 
 Experience with the animation of React Components and animation in general (or similar) 
 Understanding of asynchronous control flow 
 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related team is desired but equivalent experience will be considered 
 Programming skills/education in a 4GL development language (example: Java) 
 Familiarity/education with technologies (or similar): Docker and containers; Amazon AWS; MySQL RDBM; NOSQL DB, RBDMS 
 Familiarity/understanding of agile development and continuous integration 
 Leadership at the individual level: having the confidence and resilience to do things differently - be self-empowered 
 Communication: understand and express ideas / solutions in a comprehensive and practical format - knowledge sharing 
 User Focus: an absolute focus on the user (internal or external) experience - every aspect of a solution should be productized for ease of use 
 Improvisation: the ability to think across teams and existing boundaries (technologies / business / geographies) - lateral thinking 
 Collaboration: teamwork with a positive approach to iterative design 
 Research: an inclination to continuous research inside and outside the current focus fields 
 Influence by example: scientific proof of an idea (success or failure) as the presentation tool - represent an idea to promote it 
 Strong written and verbal communication skills 
 
 The Team 
 Would working with ground- breaking products and technologies that protect our customers excite you? Do you love collaborating with teams to solve complex problems? 
 Join our highly skilled Regulatory Technology Engineering team 
 The Fidelity Labs Regulatory Technology team is missioned with bringing new products and capabilities to market, holding end to end responsibility for full solution development. We will introduce new products to market to be used daily across the globe, across all devices & browsers. The team experience is collaborative, innovative and engaged in a start-up like atmosphere. This role has high visibility and potential in the organization. Our agile teams are based in different locations, predominately in Boston, and Dublin. Scrum teams work on all aspects of our products and work interactively. 
 COVID Work Policy 
 Safety is our top priority. Once we can be together in person with fewer safety measures, this role will follow our dynamic working approach. You’ll be spending some of your time onsite depending on the nature and needs of your role. 
 Dynamic Working – Post Pandemic 
 Our aim is to combine the best of working offsite with coming together in person. For most teams this means a consistent balance of working from home and office that supports the needs of your role, experience level, and working style. 
 Your success and growth is important to us, so you’ll want to enjoy the benefits of coming together in person – face to face learning and training, quality time with your manager and teammates, building your career network, making friends, and taking full advantage of cultural and social experiences Fidelity provides for you 
Company Overview 
 
Fidelity TalentSource is the in-house temporary staffing provider for Fidelity Investments, one of the largest and most diversified global financial services firms in the industry. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, including technology and customer service, to fill assignments across Fidelity’s U.S.-based regional and investor center locations. If you would like to experience Fidelity’s supportive and collaborative culture while expanding your skill set and developing your professional network, consider a role with Fidelity TalentSource. Apply today at FTSJobs.com. 
 
We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.
 
 Fidelity TalentSource will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, please contact our HR team at  HR@ ftsjobs.com  . 
 
 Information about Fidelity Investments 
 
At Fidelity Investments, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. As a privately held company with a rich 75-year history, our mission has remained the same since our founding:  to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients . We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com. 
 
Fidelity Investments and Fidelity TalentSource are equal opportunity employers.

We believe in the future most vehicles will be part of shared fleets that consumers access on demand. Increasingly we see vehicles transitioning from internal combustion engines to electric power plants and eventually we see autonomous drivers replacing human drivers. In order to support this future, we have built platforms that allow fleet owners to monetize their vehicles through subscription, rental, and loaner channels. We have an advanced telematics capability that allows fleet owners not only to track their vehicles location, but also remotely get detailed information about the health of the vehicle. Our platform helps the fleet owners maintain their fleet by tracking maintenance intervals and can atomically schedule service at thousands of service locations across North America. We are constantly evolving and refining our offering as our understanding of the needs of the fleets of the future evolves.
 What Youll Do 
As a Web UI Engineer on the Mobility Solutions Group, you will assist us in developing software to support the shared electric autonomous automotive future. Our frontend is built with React/Redux in TypeScript and interacts with our server-side code using a mixture of REST and GraphQL APIs. This role will focus on developing software to support many of the foundational services that enable out platform including, vehicle inventory, scheduling, and telematics. Our future vision for this area of the platform relies heavily on combining scheduling data with telematics data to produce visualizations that help our customers more efficiently run their operations.
 Due to current COVID-19 restrictions, this is a temporary work from home role but will ultimately work in the Atlanta office. 
 Qualifications: 
Must Haves 
Where permitted by applicable law, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to be considered for this U.S. based job. (Reasonable accommodations for medical and religious objections will be considered.) 
Web application expertise with JavaScript, HTML, CSS. 
5+ years of experience with at least one modern front end framework/library (React, Angular,Vue), preferably in React. 
Global state management/ Redux 
REST and/or GraphQL experience. 
Nice to Haves 
Large application insights - global store, library components, routing, lazy loading 
A visual/aesthetic perspective 
Experience working with telematics platforms 
Experience with Javascript testing tools like Cypress 
User session recording tools like LogRocket 
Experience working with map components and GIS data 
Experience working with websockets 
Who We Are 
About Cox Automotive 
Theres nothing ordinary about Cox Automotive. We are people of every background driven by our passion for mobility, innovation, client success and community outreach. We make buying, selling and owning (or simply using) cars easier for everyone. Touching more than 40,000 clients across five continents, we bring together the best brands and the best teams to propel the automotive industry forward. Some of those team members work for our iconic consumer brands like Autotrader and Kelley Blue Book, while others are creating the future of automotive at industry-facing brands like Dealer.com, Manheim and vAuto. 
 About Cox
 We are the Cox family of businesses. Weve been making our mark since 1898 by building and evolving world-class businesses, staying true to our values, and encouraging top talent to always look for growth and impact while building a career with us. Our primary divisions - Cox Communications and Cox Automotive - are driving a new wave of innovation, powering smart cities with powerhouse broadband communications and pioneering greener, more progressive transportation alternatives for individuals and fleet operators. Were also expanding into new spaces like cleantech and healthcare to rev up our momentum toward building a better future for the next generation. Were looking for the talent today who will be our leaders tomorrow. Sound intriguing? Learn more about where we are today, where we hope youll be going with us, and the common purpose that unites us at coxenterprises.com. 
Benefits of working at Cox may include health care insurance (medical, dental, vision), retirement planning (401(k)), and paid days off (sick leave, parental leave, flexible vacation/wellness days, and/or PTO). For more details on what benefits you may be offered, visit our benefits page.

Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, Cox employees, Cox hiring manager, or send to any Cox facility. 3 + years of experience working with Postgres, MySQL or MongoDB.

3 + years of experience working in agile environments with tools such as: Jira, Git, and Confluence.

Strong knowledge of current web design principles, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), responsive website development, and usability standards. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to work with all levels of client staff and management. Desired, but not required:  Experience with Umbraco (Content Management System). Title: Sr. Manager, Web Development and Digital Marketing - Washington, DC 20024 - Indeed.com
Description:
DEPARTMENT:  Strategic Communications and Campaigns
 REPORTS TO:  Deputy Director, Digital Communications and Marketing 
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:  The Sr. Manager develops and implements digital and web-based strategies and tools to strengthen Bread for the World and Bread for the World Institute’s communications, marketing, fundraising, and advocacy. As a member of the Strategic Communications and Campaigns team, the Sr. Manager develops and executes the strategic plan for researching, implementing, and expanding Bread’s digital and web-based communications, with a primary focus on website, eCRM platform, video conferencing, digital virtual events, and innovative digital tools. The Sr. Manager works with key Bread teams and vendors to achieve these goals. 
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES/ACTIVITIES: 
Leads Digital Engagement strategy across various digital technology platforms: Bread’s Website, Customer Relationship Management (eCRM) tool, Email, Microsites, Sermon and Story Repository. Work with Bread’s Managing Editor, Senior Manager of Digital Campaigns, Senior Design and Art Manager to ensure up-to-date and creative digital engagement with Bread’s audiences. 
2. Manages the development, design, and redesign of all aspects of Bread for the World's & Bread for the World Institute’s front-end web development work, including the creation of web design, wire-frames, and hosting integration as needed. Ensures a positive website user experience to reinforce the strength of Bread’s brand. This includes training staff to manage their sections in the website. 
3. Manages the gathering, tracking, reporting, and analyzing of all communications and marketing digital data, through the development and maintenance of data dashboard. Uses Google analytics and other digital tracking tools to support and inform strategic communications and marketing decision-making and suggest areas for improvement. Ensures the achievement of key digital communications and marketing benchmarks and other key performance indicators, such as growth in website tra?c and user engagement. 
4. Manages search engine marketing and other digital marketing opportunities, including search engine optimization, Google Adwords, and ad purchases, to drive increased tra?c to Bread’s websites and deepen user engagement. 
5. In coordination with the Senior Manager for Digital Campaigns and Deputy Director, Digital Communications and Marketing, helps to develop and implement organization-wide digital strategies for regular monthly digital newsletters, digital advocacy, digital organizing, digital fundraising, and growth of Bread’s/Institute’s digital network. Works closely with other departments, teams and taskforces to ensure that these strategies are planned and managed collaboratively. 
6. Manages the integration of digital strategies and priorities in the eCRM platform to support with Digital Campaigns, including the design, coding, data management, and maintenance of advocacy forms, list-segmentations, fundraiser forms, email strategies, events, ticketing forms, and stories database. Serves as an in-house expert for eCRM’s platform, providing trainings when necessary, and managing the development of new tools within this platform. Supports with the migration of donation forms, surveys, and landing pages from former eCRM to new eCRM, assisting with data maintenance and updates within Raiser’s Edge. 
7. Continually recommends, manages, and develops, appropriate digital platforms and innovative technological tools to ensure better hosting for Bread’s websites, content management systems, mass mailing systems, asset repositories, storytelling databases, live stream tools, podcasts, and event management. 
8. Explores and implements open-source technologies and software, such as Drupal, Web?ow and WordPress, that could be used to further enhance Bread’s Website, to ensure optimization of Bread digital reach. 
9. Researches, screens, and coordinates with third-party agencies, software distributors, service vendors and digital consultants involved in design, technical support, website management, virtual event management, and other digital innovations for Bread/Institute. This includes serving as the project management lead in working with vendors to oversee major website-related projects, develop products, integrate into Bread’s digital space, and provide training to staff. 
10. Serves as an in-house digital content management and constituent relationship management database expert, working with other departments and teams to ensure that Bread’s stories, digital assets, and web pages are organized, and incorporated in Bread’s digital campaigns, whether for advocacy, fundraising, and community growth, and membership ful?llment. 
11. Stays up to date on current trends in website development and design, digital fundraising, digital advocacy, integration of technology and tools, and search engine optimization. Ensures Bread is staying in alignment with, and ideally ahead of, industry standards in the digital technical landscape. 
12. Serves on the Digital Campaign Team, a cross-departmental team which meets bi-weekly to design, plan and implement digital campaigns for outreach to the organizations’ online community; Works with the Deputy Director Digital Communications and Marketing, the Senior Manager for Digital Campaigns and cross-departmentally to plan and implement Bread’s integrated digital marketing efforts. 
13. Supervises web and other digital projects. Supports on other duties as may be assigned by the Deputy Director, Digital Communications and Marketing. 
 SECONDARY RESPONSIBILITIES/ACTIVITIES:
 Contributes to the planning of the department’s annual work plan and budget. This includes helping prepare reports for the board, project funders, and for of benchmarks.
 Provides strategic technical expertise and serves in such cross-departmental teams and taskforces as the Digital Campaigns Team.
 Represents the strategic communications and campaigns department in meetings and other functions as assigned by the Director of Strategic Communications and Campaigns.
 Manages the Strategic Communications and Campaigns Department as requested, including chairing of weekly team meetings. 
SUPERVISION EXERCISED: 
Supervises Bread staff on digital technology related projects, relationships with outside vendors and consultants, and occasional interns. This includes the development and management of Audience Engagement strategy to help the Audience Engagement Manager grow audience engagement lists. 
SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE REQUIRED: 
BA or BS degree required with ten years of directly related, progressively responsible work experience in digital communications.
 Ability to work calmly in a deadline-driven, and often stressful, environment. 
Strong editorial and technical skills in website coding, website design, website hosting, and website CMS systems; strong, demonstrable writing ability, and effective communication skills.
 Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, including ability to conduct research and analyses of multiple factors related to communicating with Bread’s large and growing online network and make data-driven recommendations and decisions
 Strong leadership as a project manager for large-scale web development or other digital projects. 
Knowledge of HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Drupal, WordPress, Adobe Creative Suite, mobile applications, digital analytics services, and related digital tools.
 Ability to develop collaborative relationships internally and externally which require a high degree of diplomacy and judgment in order to address and resolve substantive conflicts or escalate concerns to management. 
Experience with digital content management and customer relations management tools. Specific experience with EveryAction, Engaging Networks, Raiser’s Edge, and Blackbaud’s product suite is a plus. 
Experience with digital fundraising processes and best practices.
 Experience with digital advocacy processes and best practices. 
Proven management/supervisory skills. 
Creative, resourceful, and solution-oriented, and has a proven track record of project management, meeting deadlines, and working in a fast-paced environment. 
Ability to work independently as up to 40% of performance and outcomes are subject to broad organizational review up and up to 60% are subject to management review. Key initiatives may be subject to executive review. 
Demonstrated ability to maintain a professional demeanor including dependability, flexibility, willingness to learn, and problem-solving skills. 
Commitment to the mission and Christian faith basis for Bread for the World. 
 
 CULTURAL EXPRESSIONS: 
Bread is committed to advancing racial equity externally and internally, all staff members play a vital role. In the course of our work, each staff person should work to apply a racial equity lens to their work and practices; and participate in racial equity and antiracism on-going training. Bread is also committed to being an equal opportunity employer. Bread does not and shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, military status, in any of its activities or operations. 
WORK ENVIRONMENT: 
Must be responsive to emails and phone calls off-site and willing to work during evenings, weekends, and holidays as the need may require. Remote work option available. 
DISCLAIMER: 
The information in this job description indicates the general nature and level of work expected of employees in this classification. It is not designed to contain, or to be interpreted as, a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, qualifications and objectives required of employees assigned to this job. 
Bread for the World is a collective Christian voice urging our nation’s decision makers to end hunger at home and abroad. By changing policies, programs and conditions that allow hunger and poverty to persist, we provide help and opportunity far beyond the communities in which we live.
 Bread for the World Institute provides policy analysis on hunger and strategies to end it.

Title: Software Engineer - Web UI (remote) - Durham, NC - Indeed.com
Description:
As a member of this Agile development team, you will design, develop, and demonstrate software in 1- or 2-week iterations as part of an Agile Release Train developing a SAFe Program Increment. You will make commitments to the business and meet those commitments as a team. You will strive for continuous improvement in knowledge and productivity and display a pattern of continual learning and a desire to broaden your software development and design skills. 
 
 Key responsibilities: 
 
 Contribute to system architecture, design, implementation, testing, delivery, and operation of components for EBSCO web-based products and services. 
 Work directly with product management and your team while analyzing and decomposing complex software requirements into simple user stories for planning and execution. 
 Collaborate with your team to estimate the size and complexity of the features. Perform the technical design, implementation, and testing of features and commit to stories to be accomplished in an iteration. 
 Own system and feature quality throughout the development, testing and deployment phases to ensure quality delivery expectations are met. 
 Drive value and build to continuously improve the quality of the team’s deliverables. Author well-engineered solutions using test-first/test-driven methodologies. 
 Conduct new technology research, proof of concept, and design work that will assist in determining direction for the enhancement of the overall system and products. 
 Provide ongoing maintenance, support and enhancements in existing systems and platforms. 
 Contribute to the continuous improvement of your team. 
 Work alongside other software engineers to elevate technology and consistently apply best practices for design, coding standards, performance, security, delivery, and maintainability. 
 Provide operational support to components that your team owns, including 24/7 availability as needed. 
 Live the principles behind the Agile Manifesto and SAFe framework in all interactions. 
 
 Required skills or experience: 
 
 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Computer Engineering or other Technical related degree or equivalent experience. 
 Hands on experience developing, delivering, and supporting public-facing web applications. 
 2+ years of experience developing in one or more JavaScript frameworks, such as React, AngularJS, or Node.js. 
 2+ years of experience in large systems software design and development, with hands on experience using RESTful Web Services, HTML/CSS, XML/JSON, HTTP and SSL. 
 2+ years of experience writing unit and integration tests. 
 Proficiency with source code management tools such as git.

Title: Mobile Developer-REACT Native (remote) - Durham, NC - Indeed.com
Description:
If you are looking for an opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, EBSCO Information Services is a company that you want to explore! 
 
 EBSCO Information Services is looking to further grow by adding a Software Engineer to our development team. This engineer will work as part of an agile (SAFE) team to develop “green field” projects focused on designing, architecting, and building our core software products onto the Amazon Web Services (AWS) platform. Mobile app development will be the initial focus and preferred candidates will be fluent in React Native, Objective C, etc. 
 
 Key responsibilities include: 
 Work with a team on design, implementation, testing and delivery of high-volume customer-facing mobile applications that support EBSCO’s products and services. 
 Collaborate with product management and your team while analyzing and decomposing complex software features into simpler stories for planning and execution. 
 Collaborate with your team to manage and estimate the size and complexity of the features/stories. Perform the technical design, implementation, and testing of feature/stories and commit to what can be accomplished within an iteration. 
 Own system and feature quality throughout the development, testing and deployment phases to ensure quality delivery expectations are met. 
 Make suggests to continuously improve the quality of the team’s deliverables. 
 Conduct new technology research, proof of concept, and design work that will provide direction for the enhancement of the overall system and products. 
 Adhere to software engineering best practices for design, coding standards, performance, security, accessibility, delivery and maintainability. 
 Demonstrate ownership of developed components from development through production. 
 
 Required Skills: 
 2+ years of React Native development experience. 
 2+ years of professional mobile app development experience. 
 At least one iOS / Android App completed and presentable. 
 Solid understanding of iOS and Android app deployment procedures. (Store deployment, Enterprise deployment, certificates, provisioning profiles). 
 Must have knowledge of iOS and Android local storage paradigms. (User defaults, keychain storage, core data). 
 2+ years of experience supporting enterprise mobile apps. 
 
 Preferred Skills: 
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, or similar. 
 1+ years of experience with Node.js. 
 1+ years of Objective C or Java experience. 
 Experience and understanding of UI/UX design principles for mobile devices. 
 Solid understanding of OOP concepts, patterns and practices. 
 Understanding of private and public cloud design considerations and limitations in the areas of virtualization and global infrastructure, distributed systems, load balancing, networking, and security. 
 Hands on experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform). 
 Hands on experience with microservices. 
 Advocate of unit testing, automation and test-driven development. 
 Understanding of Agile software engineering principles and methodologies. 
 2+ years of experience with RESTful Web Services and how to integrate them using the iOS / Android framework. 
 Basic knowledge of GIT or other version control software. 
 
 Important things that you will bring to our culture, but things that we can’t teach: 
 Drive - Positive Attitude - Good Judgement - Open Communication – Collaboration – A Desire to Make an Impact - Eager to Understand – Accountability – Decisiveness – You’re a Team Player 
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and comply with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. We strictly prohibit and do not tolerate discrimination against employees, applicants, or any other covered persons because of race, color, sex, pregnancy status, age, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, religion, creed, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment. We comply with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), as amended by the ADA Amendments Act, and all applicable state or local law.

Title: Senior .NET Frontend Developer - United States - Indeed.com
Description:

*** Remote position - open to non-local candidates in the nation (need to overlap with team in PST and MST time zone). 1 year duration - likely to extend or convert to full time.  Candidate must work on our W2.   no third-party candidates.***
 
 
 Job Description: 
 
The Software Developer III is responsible for the design and implementation of an enterprise class, business critical datacenter management solution. The product architecture is composed of distributed, highly scalable/available, cross platform components written in C# and a front-end architecture composed of a JavaScript framework utilizing current HTML 5 and CSS 3 standards and supported by a RESTful (PHP) Web Service backend. The role will leverage modern technologies, language standards and industry best practices to deliver an enterprise-class application to a global customer base. This role will be under the management of our direct client's R&D Leader.
 
The role requires an individual who can work collaboratively within an Agile software development environment with multiple platform teams consisting of onsite and remote developers. The developer shall be responsible for the estimation, design, implementation, and unit testing of all assigned tasks within a time-boxed sprint. In addition this role is responsible for conducting and participating in collaborative design and code review, offering and accepting feedback on logic and structural code changes which are either more compliant with internal standards/guidelines or are more robust.
 
 
 Job Responsibilities: 
 
* On-time delivery of quality releases of committed Sprint assignments
 
* Adherence to Development standards and best practices in the design and implementation of software
 
* Development of robust, scalable and extendable Web architecture, including architecture design documentation
 
* Active participant in design and code reviews
 
* Active participant in requirement estimation and task decomposition
 
* Conduct knowledge transfers and test case reviews with QA
 
* Resolution of pre and post production defects within set SLAs
 
 
 Skills, Abilities and Experience   : 
* Bachelor's/Master's Degree in a relevant field of study or an equivalent combination of education and software development related experience
 
* A minimum of 5-8 years of hands-on, recent experience developing web applications
 
* Proven team player accustomed to accelerated development cycles with a proven track record of meeting deliverables
 
* Passionate, organized, self-motivated, positive team/solution oriented individual is preferred
 
* Experience developing cross platform backend solutions (preferred)
 
* Experience developing web services - any language (preferred)
 
* Experience designing and building enterprise class software leveraging complex data structures optimized for performance and footprint is (preferred)
 
* Experience in the development of highly scalable, multi-threaded distributed systems (preferred)
 
 
 Technology, Tooling and Methodology: 
 
* Previous experience in an Agile development life cycle
 
* Proficient in Microsoft Studio, Git, JIRA
 
* Fundamental-level proficiency in collaboration applications (i.e.: MS Team, SharePoint)
 
 
 Must Have: 
 
-Javascript
 
- HTML 5
 
- C#
 
- Looking to have web application/full stack developer, front or end, preference is front end.
 
 
 Nice to have: 
 
- GITlab
 
- JIRA
 
- Previous experience in an Agile development life cycle
 
- RESTful (PHP 7)
 
- Data center management experience
 
 
 Education/Experience: 
 
Bachelor's/Master's Degree in a relevant field of study or an equivalent combination of education and software development related experience
 
A minimum of 5-8 years of hands-on, recent experience developing web applications

Title: Remote Full Stack .NET/React Developer - Minnesota - Indeed.com
Description:
Remote Full Stack .NET/React Developer
 We are now hiring for remote associates! 
 Work on remote .NET/ React projects with clients across the US. 
 
 As an Intertech staff consultant, building smart technology is just the beginning. Working as part of the Intertech consulting team elevates your work to a higher level. Are you stuck on something? Chat with some of the most experienced developers in the Twin Cities. Clients know when they get one of our consultants, they get access to one of the most complete development teams in the Midwest. 
 If Intertech sounds like a place where you could thrive, check out this new opportunity on our team: 
 Description 
 We’re looking for you and other exceptional people to join our award-winning team! Do you want to take charge of your own career? Do you want to grow and become a leader/authority in the software field, and wish to stay on top of your game while learning the latest technology that will help you in your career? We are hiring and growing those who wish to grow and share their knowledge with others. 
 Responsibilities 
 You will use your exceptional ability to clearly communicate both written and verbally 
 Learn and gain new technical skills quickly (Intertech is an IT training company as well, you will have access to the latest training courses and technology) 
 At times you will lead and mentor Intertech employees as well as client staff 
 Utilize your experience in building dynamic applications in an Agile environment 
 Implement and develop best practices for clients as well as Intertech. 
 Use cross-collaboration with other Intertech team members for the purpose of staff and client growth, as well as your own growth. We help each other grow along with our clients, by living the Intertech brand through top quality results and client relationships. 
 
 Requirements 
 5+ years of solid software development experience 
 Total commitment to Intertech’s values of Attitude, Commitment, and Excellence (ACE Employee) 
 Architecture and development experience in enterprise applications 
 An understanding and knowledge of .NET, .NET Core, Web Services, ReactJS, Patterns/OO Design, and Web Frameworks 
 Additional experience with most of the following:
 .NET Framework 
 C# 
 ASP.NET 
 ReactJS or similar technology 
 JavaScript, TypeScript 
 Agile Design Patterns 
 HTML, CSS 
 Visual Studio 
 MS SQL Server 
 Cloud Technology (Azure/AWS) 
 
 Why Intertech? 
 We take pride in creating an environment where employees can be happy, as shown by our numerous employee satisfaction awards. Joining Intertech not only means joining an award-winning company culture, but it also means working on great projects with terrific customers. We truly believe our people, the work we do and every single one of our client’s matter. Here are a few other fun benefits that come along with a job at Intertech: 
 Cool Perks 
 3-month paid sabbaticals 
 $1500 home office setup stipend 
 Quarterly company webinars and business review 
 Monthly virtual Lunch-and-Learns 
 1 Week of paid training every year 
 Opportunities to contribute to our company blog and podcasts no matter your level of seniority 
 Open and transparent communications within the firm, which means you have a voice in the strategy and direction of the company 
 An environment that allows staff growth, personally and professionally, through challenging projects 
 
 Balance 
 Some companies flaunt work-life balance in company brochures. We live it. On average Intertech consultants worked 40.25 hours per week over the last year. We don’t believe in those 60-70 hour weeks at other consulting firms. However, when you work Overtime you are paid for it. For OT if we get paid more than 40 hours from the client, you get paid.

Title: Experienced Frontend Web Developer - Full Time On Site - East Brunswick, NJ 08816 - Indeed.com
Description: Experienced Frontend Web Developer Job Description Thorium Digital is a growing digital agency that has provided services to clients from startups to Fortune 500 companies. We are comprised of self-motivated, professionally sharp and team work oriented individuals. We are looking to expand our local team in East Brunswick, NJ. You will be working in a collaborative and flat structured working environment where there are plenty of opportunities to learn and grow with us. We also offer flexible summer hours year-round. The Frontend Web Developer must be able to manage multiple concurrent web development projects as well as maintenance and support. Individual must have a strong technical foundation as well as a full understanding of common coding standards, configuration management, and full life cycle systems development. The Frontend Web Developer is an experienced on-site (East Brunswick, NJ) full time role. The candidate must have minimum 3 - 4 years of experience working as a frontend web developer, and must have strong experience in HTML5, Javascript, CSS, & ReactJS, with some backend web experience. The candidate must be able to work effectively with our client’s technical leads, our other in-house developers, and non-technical staff. This person would have strong communication skills and possess the ability to present complex technical information to a wide range of audiences, from other technical staff to senior management. Individual should be a fast learner of new technologies, be a creative thinker, share skills and information freely, and be able to mentor and train other developers. Frontend Web Developer Responsibilities Participate in the full SDLC, including planning meetings, development, estimations and design sessions. Deliver project assignments on time, within budget and with high quality. Understand and analyze project risks and provide risk mitigation. Translate design materials (Photoshop, Figma, etc.) into HTML/CSS. Individual will be responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware and software and related infrastructure. Document daily progress on work items & communicate to appropriate stakeholders. Work out of hours, when appropriate, to support major implementations or to react to high priority service issues. Guide development of tools, infrastructure, and processes within the configuration, build and release process. Decompose high-level information into details and abstract up from low-level information to resolve solution vs. requirements conflicts. Provide expertise in determining the strategic technical direction and system architecture for projects, as needed. Work as part of a team to help define technical requirements, explain the capabilities and limitations of various systems, and generate diagrams/documentation for internal and client use. Provide assistance, training, and/or mentoring to the other developers and other team members. Other duties as assigned. Frontend Web Developer Qualifications Minimum 3 - 4 years of experience working as a frontend web developer. Strong experience in HTML5, Javascript, CSS, & ReactJS. Working knowledge of Figma, Photoshop, and/or Illustrator Be detailed oriented and must be able to multi-task, manage details, and keep sight of overall objectives. Able to work well under pressure and to tight deadlines within a dynamic environment. Must possess an exceptional ability to effectively communicate both verbally and nonverbally, with technical and non-technical personnel. Strong work ethic, positive attitude, and a desire to work in a challenging position. Individual must have a strong technical foundation as well as a full understanding of common coding standards and configuration management. Understand the complete deployment life cycle from design, build, test, and deployment. Experience with cloud computing configuration and administration (AWS, or Azure). Familiarity with one or more version control systems (Git, Bitbucket). Technical knowledge of PHP/PHP Frameworks (e.g. Laravel or Lumen), Object-Oriented programming, design patterns, and best practices. Experience managing resources within a budget and project schedule. Excellent analytical and creative problem solving skills. Must be able to speak English fluently. Must be able to commute to East Brunswick, NJ office when we reopen – on site (currently remote due to COVID-19). Reopen date TBD. Authorized to work in US without sponsorship. Job Types: Full-time Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Employee assistance program Employee discount Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Paid time off Parental leave Referral program Tuition reimbursement Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay COVID-19 considerations: All staff working remotely currently. We follow all safety protocols when you come in the office. The office reopen date is TBD until we decide it is safe to reopen. Ability to commute/relocate: East Brunswick, NJ 08816: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: React: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19 Work Location: One location

Title: Front End Developer - Fort Collins, CO 80528 - Indeed.com
Description:
Crafting marketing leadership – one client team at a time 
 
At Refactored, we believe in marketing’s ability to drive business results and organizational change. We also believe that a marketing agency can be a powerful accelerator for building and supporting effective internal marketing teams. By helping our clients mature their approach to marketing, they elevate their practice to a leadership position within their organization. We aim to solve today’s challenges while providing strategies and solutions that build greater capability, improve marketing’s performance, and ensure our work together has a lasting positive impact on their business. 
We have the capability to deliver a broad range of marketing services to most any B2B company. We provide everything from branding and content to digital marketing and website development. However, we prefer to focus on clients who fit a specific profile, are interested in purchasing integrated solutions, and are seeking a longer-term and more impactful partnership. Today, every one of our staff members plays an active and important role in the life of our clients — each delivering their unique contribution to the success of business-critical initiatives. We serve clients by working in close partnership with their executives and SMEs. Clients trust our advice and vision, and we are the strategic center for digital programs that demand creative thinking, integrated problem solving, and ownership. If you want to take a leadership role in the development of new business opportunities to help us create innovative marketing solutions that drive bottom line results — then you’ve found your new home. 
Ready to build something great? 
 
What feels just as good as building a web project that you know is awesome? Seeing that project produce amazing results and a happy client. 
Front End Developer 
We are looking for a talented Front-End Developer to join our team in Northern Colorado to help us serve a growing list of clients. 
 
In this role, you will be working collaboratively with our technology and strategy teams to develop solutions for a full range of digital projects and marketing programs with an emphasis on quality and results for our clients. 
The ideal candidate is a lifelong learner, has an eye for detail, and understands how to write reusable and efficient code following industry best practices. 
Responsibilities 
 
Develop creative, functional, maintainable, and performance-driven web applications, websites, and components. 
 Write high-quality, re-usable code following industry best practices. 
 Contribute to project-based work as well as our internal library of reusable components. 
 Investigate and resolve bugs or deficiencies in project codebase. 
 Provide development estimates for enhancement requests. 
 Complete other duties as assigned. 
 
 
Competencies 
 
In order to flourish in this roll, you will need the following: 
 
 2-4 years commercial experience as a Front-end Engineer 
 Strong JavaScript skills 
 React experience, including knowledge and experience in dealing with state management 
 Strong HTML and CSS (SCSS) Skills 
 Good knowledge of responsive web design 
 Experience with Git or other source control systems 
 Excellent people skills, very client focused 
 Understanding of CI/CD processes 
 A creative and persistent problem-solving approach 
 
 Ideal candidate would also have: 
 
 Some server-side language skills 
 Experience with Static Site Generators (Gatsby, Nextjs, etc) 
 Experience with Azure, AWS, Netlify would be a great advantage 
 Experience with Node 
 Experience with GraphQL 
 Experience developing sites that utilize a Headless CMS (e.g. Contenful, DatoCMS, Sanity.io, Storyblock, Kontent, etc.) 
 Experience developing sites in traditional CMS a plus (Kentico, Wordress, Sitefinity, Drupal, etc). 
 
 
Why come work for us? 
 
It’s amazing when you work for a company that focuses on the success of its clients  and   its employees simultaneously. Our clients are well matched with our culture so that we can focus on delivering quality work within a framework of mutual respect, appropriate and available budgets for the tasks at hand, and a joint understanding of how effective marketing programs should be initiated. For you, this means you’ll be a trusted advisor in the life of our clients, have strategic control over how programs develop and execute, and you’ll be a part of delivering high-impact solutions for our clients. Personally, we’ll provide you a working environment that’s flexible, enjoyable, and professionally rewarding. 
We're a recognized, award-winning agency and have been recognized with 24 Awards in the last 3-years. 
 
2019 Transform Awards - Best Rebrand of a Digital Property 
 2019 ITSMA Marketing Excellence Awards – Finalist: ABM Pilot Program 
 2019 B2 Awards from ANA - Search Advertising and Web Presence 
 2019 Silver Stevie Award - Marketing Solution for Sales & Customer Service 
 2018 Gold Key Awards from BMA Colorado - Best of Show for SEO, Website $150K+, ABM Program 
 
 
We offer— 
 
A competitive salary and paid training 
 Opportunities for professional growth through training, conferences, and continued education 
 Generous vacation time 
 Collaboration with passionate, seasoned professionals 
 A casual, comfortable working environment 
 An easy commute to our office in Windsor, Colorado 
 Monthly team lunches 
 Health, dental, vision and short/long term disability insurance 
 401k with 3% contribution to help you plan for your future 
 
 
Please note, this is not a remote position. Once our offices are re-open from the COVID-19 pandemic closure, this will be a full-time, in person role in our Ft. Collins, CO office. The salary range for this position is between $75,000 and $95,000 and is based on years of experience in a similar role and education.

Title: Front End Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: Who We Are We are a systems engineering team with members from a variety of professional backgrounds who are united in a quest to deliver enterprise-class solutions to our clients. This includes building scalable, secure, consumer-facing web and mobile apps for a variety of audiences and business needs. Our process is simple – we work in close collaboration with our clients to create solutions that address their unique challenges. We work with our clients, not as an implementation vendor, but as a strategic partner. We seek to understand their needs, call upon our unique experiences and prescribe solutions that address their strategic goals. What We’re Looking For You engineer systems. You understand that complexity is easy and simplicity is hard - and chose to do the hard things. Clean and efficient code is important to you. You want to build things that have meaning and take on big challenges. You have an entrepreneurial spirit. You understand that no plan survives first contact with the enemy and see each new challenge through to the end. You choose action over inaction. You take calculated risks and can communicate the potential risks and outcomes. You are passionate about building great software. Quality is very important to you. You understand the value of testing: unit tests, automated testing, performance testing. You understand the responsibility that comes with building consumer facing applications – either as part of a team or by yourself - and are excited by the opportunity to create systems that consumers use and depend on. You understand software development, not just tool xyz or framework foo. Your experience extends into many tools and frameworks and are always experimenting with the latest tech to see how it can help you solve new problems. While you have a wide range of exposure to frameworks and tools, once you find The (latest) One, you dive in and become an expert. You think in terms of scale. Once you make it work, you think about how it'll work at scale: what happens when there are 100 users? 10,000 users? 1,000,000 users? Make it work, make it right. Preferred Experience Experience consulting with clients - either on the side or as a part of your job responsibilities. Experience developing consumer-facing software. Experience taking designs and building pixel-perfect functional versions. Cloud development and architecture with AWS or Azure. Application performance optimization and tuning best practices. Application security best practices. Frontend development such as Angular (1.x/2+), React, Ember, etc. Back-end development such as Node.js, .NET (C#), etc. Responsive design with CSS or CSS frameworks. Design frameworks such as Bootstrap, Foundation, etc. Automating testing, integration, deployments, monitoring. Must have a strong customer service orientation, good organizational skills and the ability to work independently. Available as a remote position. Salary range is 40K to 65K Job Type: Full-time Salary: $40,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year Schedule: Monday to Friday Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Angular: 1 year (Preferred) related: 3 years (Preferred) building pixel-perfect websites: 3 years (Preferred) Work Location: Remote

Title: Front End Developer (100% Remote) - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview: 
BluePath Labs is a fast-growing research and consulting company committed to solving complex problems at the nexus of data and strategy. We are looking for a Junior or Mid-Level Front-End Developer to help us build data-rich applications supporting a diverse set of public and private sector clients. 
This is a full-time and remote position. We offer competitive benefits and supportive remote work arrangements. You must be a U.S. citizen to apply. 
As a Front-End Developer, you will develop, test, and deploy secure, data-driven applications for web platforms. You will work with dynamic and accomplished teammates on finding solutions to a wide variety of unique and challenging problems. As part of our growing Development team, you will be expected to craft dynamic user interfaces for a variety of web applications. The ability to create working components based on a design comp using modern and responsive web development techniques with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript are a must. Experience in a modern, reactive JavaScript framework such as Angular, REACT, or VueJS is preferred. Any UI design experience in addition to coding ability is a major plus. 
The ideal candidate will have a great eye for good visual design and UX and pay attention to the details that take a site from 'good' to 'great'. They will have excellent communication skills, and the ability to self-motivate and work independently to deadlines and deliverables. 
Primary responsibilities will include: Developing, testing, deploying, and maintaining front-end code for secure, scalable web applications. Working with project teams to scope features and user experience/interface design. Coding user interfaces with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to match provided design comps and feature requirements. Producing thoughtful, scalable, reusable code that adheres to an internal Design System. Following project plans and providing scoping/timing estimates for appropriate tasks, and pro-actively communicating issues that may affect them. 
Required Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field. 2+ years of experience building, testing, deploying, and maintaining highly-performant and secure web applications. Experience in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Experience creating web pages and/or components to match design comps and/or wireframes. Experience working with retrieving data from secure RESTful APIs to render their data on the front-end. Experience working with a code version control system such as Git or an equivalent technology. 
Desired Qualifications: Experience working with VueJS or equivalent JavaScript framework. Experience developing reusable web components. Experience using web frameworks such as Material UI, Quasar, etc. Experience analyzing customer requirements and creating wireframes and design comps of user interfaces to meet those requirements using design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Illustrator and Photoshop. 
About BluePath: 
BluePath's extensive experience in Government, Military, Commercial, and Academic environments is unique among small businesses and a core differentiator of our solutions. Our multidisciplinary background allows us to solve diverse and complex problems. Most importantly, we work closely with our clients to frame problems correctly, optimize processes, leverage technologies, and implement enduring solutions. Labs are where ideas are born, experiments occur, and breakthroughs happen. It is the hallmark of BluePath's culture. 
https://www.bluepathlabs.com/

Title: Front End Developer - Returnship - New York, NY - Indeed.com
Description:
Experience with object-oriented design 
 2+ years of professional non-internship experience with front end, web or mobile software development using JavaScript, HTML and CSS 
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline (or equivalent experience). 
 Must be unemployed for 1+ years 
 3 + years of industry experience 
 Is not currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program 
 Open to relocate to New York 
 
This 16-week, paid, virtual employment opportunity is available to candidates who are looking to resume their professional career after experiencing 1+ years of underemployment and/or unemployment. The successful candidate will meet all of the basic qualifications of this position and can reside anywhere within the United States. Upon successful completion of the returnship, candidates may receive, but are not guaranteed, an offer for full-time employment. In addition to successfully completing the returnship requirements, offers for full-time employment are contingent upon business need and the candidate’s advance commitment to relocate, if necessary, to a within commuting distance of the assigned work location office. Relocation assistance is provided for full-time employment opportunities.
 
This program offers you a chance to revamp your skills, update your resume with new experience, and make connections with other professionals who are returning to their careers.
 
Amazon Advertising is dedicated to driving measurable outcomes for brand advertisers, agencies, authors, and entrepreneurs. Our ad solutions—including sponsored, display, video, and custom ads—leverage Amazon’s innovations and insights to find, attract, and engage intended audiences throughout their daily journeys. With a range of flexible pricing and buying models, including self-service, managed service, and programmatic ad buying, these solutions help businesses build brand awareness, increase product sales, and more.
 
The Global Advertising Partner Development team helps suppliers, agencies, marketers, authors, content creators, designers, non-endemic advertisers and developers to scale their use of Amazon Advertising and grow their business by surfacing a diverse selection of products to millions of worldwide Amazon customers. We do this via software tools and marketing/engagement programs that enable developers (internal and external) and partners (agencies and tool providers) to better serve advertiser needs.
 
 
 Experience building scalable front-end infrastructure software or distributed systems. 
 Exposure to Front-end libraries/framework - primarily React. 
 Good understanding of software languages like JavaScript, NodeJS 
 Demonstrated leadership abilities in an engineering environment in driving operational excellence and best practices. 
 Able to solve difficult software and UX problems with some ambiguity. Pushes for information to avoid solving the wrong problem and mitigate UI risks early in the process to avoid feature delays. Can decompose a problem into clear software and UX design actions. 
 Can articulate the risks and benefits of depending on front-end libraries, frameworks, and tool-set

Title: Junior Front End Developer - Dallas, TX 75201 - Indeed.com
Description:
What Gives Us Purpose
 Royalty Advocate builds robust, scalable analytics platforms for oil and gas mineral owners. We are focused on modernizing antiquated, paper-based workflows to help our clients maximize their revenue potential. In addition, we work to make it easier and faster to identify potential problems with their portfolios and provided workflows to aid in the process of resolving these issues.
 
Royalty Advocate focuses on SaaS, Enterprise Software, and Energy. The company has offices in Scottsdale, AZ with a team of 1-10 employees. To date, Royalty Advocate has raised $3M of funding; the latest round was closed on April 2021.
 
What We seek
 We are looking for a junior front-end developer to join our development team. You should have 2 to 3 years of relevant work experience as a web developer, with experience in JavaScript and typescript.
 
At all times, you will be working with the product team and other developers to bridge the gap between graphic design and technical implementation, taking an active role in defining how the application looks, as well as how it works. Ideally, you should be able to demonstrate hands-on experience in using current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance optimization, accessibility, and usability.
 Since this is a start up with a small development team, you will need to have a self-driven, conscientious mentality with a commitment to creating innovations through high-quality work.
 
What Your Day Will Look Like
 In general, you’ll work closely with the product team and other developers to create elegant, usable, responsive and interactive interfaces for a web app environment. You will, therefore:
 
 gain feedback continuously from users, customers, and colleagues 
 monitor app performance, watch for traffic drops related to site usability problems and rectify any issues 
 write functional requirement documents and guides 
 create quality mockups and prototypes, ensuring high-quality graphic standards and brand consistency 
 turn UI/UX designs into prototypes, creating excellent interactions from designs 
 write reusable code and libraries (with matching documentation) to a standard which makes it quick and easy to maintain the code in the future 
 optimize applications for maximum speed 
 optimize applications for maximum scalability 
 aid with the design of new features, or maintenance of old features 
 collaborate with back-end developers and product team to improve usability 
 help back-end developers with troubleshooting 
 stay up to date with emerging technologies 
 
 You’re perfect for this role if you: 
 
 enjoy the challenge of taking part in complex technical projects and delivering iterative solutions that provide value. 
 perform well in a self-driven, startup environment where remaining agile at all times is critical 
 enjoy working closely with partners across the business and within your team to solve problems 
 are a great communicator who is focused on discovering and delivering solutions 
 facilitating meaningful discussions 
 genuinely enjoy sharing your knowledge with others 
 
What You Bring
 
 profound knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3 
 proficiency in JavaScript or TypeScript 
 proficiency with JavaScript frameworks, specifically Angular 2+ 
 solid experience in using a complex REST API from the client-side 
 a solid understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them 
 good knowledge and practical experience of client-side build/config management 
 good understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git, Mercurial, or SVN 
 
What We Provide
 At Royalty Advocate, we ask a lot of our employees, which is why we give so much in return. In addition to your competitive salary, medical/dental/vision plan, and matching 401(k), we have company-sponsored events, continuous learning opportunities, and the flexibility to manage your work/life balance.

Title: Front End Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: Front End Developer ** Job Overview New Breed is a fast-growing revenue performance management firm seeking to hire experienced and talented individuals. We have roles for people with various skill sets, and we can work with you to identify where/how yours can fit with our organization. New Breed believes in giving our team members the opportunity to forge their own paths, allowing them to add value and make an impact every day. In this role, you will operate as a skilled designer and front-end developer. You will be responsible for developing HubSpot and WordPress-based websites, working closely with our Product Team to design and develop custom websites and other online solutions for our clients, and advancing the skill set of junior-level team members. In this role you will:  Assist in the production of high-quality and innovative websites, built on the HubSpot or WordPress CMS. This includes both design and development work. Work in HubSpot to develop templates, emails, blogs, and provide troubleshooting assistance. Produce traditional marketing pieces (ex: logos, sales sheets, posters, etc.) Assist in launching websites. Train the client on keeping website up to date after launch. Always be solving for the customer and ensure client satisfaction. Adhere to production schedules and work under tight deadlines. Provide mentoring and training to junior-level team members. Enhance skill set over time to keep up with modern UI trends and techniques. Fill in for senior-level product team members to be client-facing when needed. A strong candidate will have:  A strong background in Graphic Design. A good design portfolio. A strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, Javascript/jQuery, HubL/Jinja. Understanding of basic DNS properties. Strong Adobe Photoshop skills (other Creative Suite programs a plus). Experience with website analytics, SEO techniques, social media tools, and other online marketing strategies. Be open to learning new platforms. Be able to communicate design decisions and accept constructive feedback from clients on your choices. Be passionate about doing B2B marketing for the fastest-growing technology and software companies. A willingness to learn, help out, and go the extra mile. Be driven and determined to continually grow as a person and as a professional. Take initiative: Identify opportunities for improvement and take them to the next level without being told. Be flexible and adaptable in managing your time and schedule in a rapidly-changing environment. A positive attitude in everything you do. Be always ready to take on a new challenge and the intuition and good judgment to get through it successfully. Superior communication skills, incredible writing skills, strong listening skills and excellent quantitative skills Audacious goals and the drive to be your best in a competitive space. Where you’ll work:  Our ideal candidate will be located in New England. We're also open to hiring in the following states: New York, North Carolina, Florida, Indiana, Tennessee, Texas. Work remotely or join our local team in Burlington, VT and spend your day on our state-of-art campus on the shores of Lake Champlain. If you live close to our office, we also offer fully remote work options for our local team, or you can choose a hybrid model and split your time between working from your home and our office! What's in it for you? Unlimited PTO, top-tier benefits, competitive salary, 401k, and more! A community dedicated to expanding our own experiences, learning and growing based on the following belief: Individuals can realize their full potential only when given the freedom to apply the full breadth of their unique life experiences to their work; therefore, it is our responsibility to reflect, support and advance this diversity. Opportunities for growth: We enable our team members to build their dream job at New Breed, and opportunities for advancement can span beyond just demonstrating rockstar performance. We are proud to offer “tours of duty," an active plan designed to provide team members with a clearly defined path to build new skills and grow across the organization. Join a team of passionate people, hone your craft, and make a direct impact on some of the world's fastest-growing technology and software companies. Job Type: Full-time

Title: Front End Developer/Designer VIRTUAL! - Dallas, TX 75202 - Indeed.com
Description:
As a leading provider of human capital solutions, we help our clients and their people navigate the complexity of health, wealth and HR. We combine data-driven, consumer-centered technology with personalized care and service to deliver a superior customer experience. Our dedicated colleagues across 28 global centers help 23 million people and their 11 million family members simplify work and life, both now and in the future. At Alight, we are reimagining how people and organizations thrive. 
We’re looking for an experienced and profoundly engaged Front-End Developer, who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. 
The Front-end Developer/Designer will be responsible for implementing visual elements that users see and interact within our applications and ensuring the alignment of design and user experience requirements, optimizing web pages for maximum efficiency and maintaining brand consistency across all web pages, among other duties. You will work alongside Back-end Developers and Product Designers to ensure all elements of our applications creation are consistent. 
Key responsibilities 
Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application.
 Work with the Product designer and bridge the gap between design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.
 Determining the structure and design of web pages and applications.
 Ensuring user experience determines design choices.
 Developing features to enhance the user experience.
 Striking a balance between functional and aesthetic design.
 Ensuring design is optimized for smartphones.
 Building reusable code for future use and optimizing for maximum speed and scalability.
 Utilizing a variety of markup languages to write web pages.
 Maintaining brand consistency throughout design.
 Be in charge of projects assigned to you, and use the strong relationships you've created to gather, refine and create the interactive presentations. 
Set-up regular check-in points with the relevant stakeholders to keep any project on track and all involved up to date with the progress. 
Work with other teams within the business to make sure all visuals are in line with the product branding. 
Be able to work well within a small team and support colleagues on any ad-hoc requirements. 
Proactively solve problems and review ways to improve business processes, competencies, tools, standards, and best practices. 
Represent the team in all meetings and events required by Products and Alight in general. 
Other duties including, but not limited to, assisting other teams from time to time. 
Knowledge, skills & experience 
Excellent knowledge and understanding of HTML, CSS and Javascript. 
Good understanding of data exchange concepts (database, api, json, etc..). 
Angular front-end a must, React, Vue experience a plus. 
Experience working with json and json parsing. 
Knowledge of cross browser compatibility, components based web development, Sass, Typescript. 
Experience with component-based web development libraries, Storybook experience a must 
Proven ability to effectively communicate with others to achieve desired results; must be approachable and open-minded. 
Ability to adhere to corporate standards and styles. 
Strong team interaction with the ability to work with geographically dispersed teams. 
Service-oriented with a strong sense of accountability. 
Able to work under pressure of tight deadlines. 
A very good eye for detail while safeguarding the big picture. 
Strong problem-solving skills. 
Flexibility and patience in working in a challenging environment.

Description:
Don’t just land a job. Launch your future. 
Our all-in-one software platform gives HR pros a way to easily manage daily tasks in payroll, benefits, talent, and workforce management. 
But what makes us different is that our technology is backed by a culture that cares. We care about our team members, clients, and partners – because people matter most. And people have always been at the heart of our business. 
Since our founding in 1997, this is the thing that's stayed the same, from our employees to the millions of users nationwide that access our platform. We pride ourselves on partnering with our clients to build the workplace they and their employees crave. 
Let's go forward together. 
Position Overview: 
Paylocity, known for our best-in-class modern workforce solutions and service, is looking for a  Front   End   Developer  as part of our rapidly growing Marketing team. Consistently named among the top companies to work for, best companies to sell for, and fastest-growing software companies, Paylocity offers the opportunity to work for a vibrant, innovative company with a strong, healthy company culture. And to top it off, our CEO’s been named a Glassdoor Top CEO for four consecutive years! 
Our talented  Marketing team  is all about embracing and encouraging a culture based on teamwork, collaboration, intellectual curiosity, and immense growth. Reporting to the Manager, Corporate Website, the Front End Developer role is tailored for a candidate that is passionate about implementing front end user experiences and will help translate designs and marketing goals into high-performing website enhancements. The ideal candidate is a technical individual who embraces opportunities to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment. 
Location:  Remote 
Reports To:  Manager Corporate Website 
Responsibilities: 
The below represents the primary duties of the position, others may be assigned as needed. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
Work with marketing teams and designers to create customer facing, high-performance web pages and modules in content management system 
Participate in the full development lifecycle with agency, including the research of latest trends and website features, effort estimation, specifications, managing dev queue, QA, and the deployment of new and modified functionality 
Implement well designed, efficient, and clean code that follows the present system and style using standard programming languages and practices 
Build and implement A/B and multivariate tests in testing tool to improve UX experience and conversion performance 
Identify, debug, utilize available resources, correct, and update errors or exceptions in the front and back-end systems 
Proactively prioritize, manage, and collaborate with team members and our agency on incoming website requests 
Routinely test and optimize website for user experience, including site speed, module interaction and engagement and most importantly path to conversion. 
Continuously refine our processes to deliver value faster and improve the quality and sustainability of our website 
Thoroughly QA the performance of all site functionality including form validation and values importing from the front end to back-end systems accurately throughout multiple instances. 
Follow web best practices, including usability and accessibility standards 
Requirements: 
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field 
6+ years’ experience with front end web development languages (HTM5L, CSS3, Java Script, Bootstrap, jQuery...etc.) and a proficient understanding of usability principles, responsive web design, cross-browser compatibility when styling dynamic content 
2+ years of content management system experience required (Umbraco experience a plus) 
Background in understanding UX, page performance, and execution from a Marketing perspective a strong plus 
Ability to work within deadlines in a fast-paced, B2B tech SaaS based company 
Self-directed learner who picks up unfamiliar systems and applications quickly 
Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a team as well as work independently 
Strong detail oriented, multi-tasker with critical thinking problem-solving skills 
Candidate must have a strong eye for web design/user experience and possess the ability to create front-end development from XD prototypes. Working knowledge of Adobe Photoshop preferred. 
Have a technical understanding of how site speed, back end functionality, and accessibility influence search engine optimization 
Our journey forward.

 The Auburn University Media Production Group is looking for a skilled web developer who will be responsible for developing websites and interactive multimedia for our clients. You will be working alongside a team of designers to conceptualize and plan installations and websites that you will implement, maintain, and update. 
 
Temporary Employment Services (TES), a unit of the Auburn University Department of Human Resources, is an in-house support center established to meet the temporary employment needs of the university. TES provides qualified and dedicated temporary employees in a wide variety of occupations to meet the staffing needs throughout the campus. Temporary employees are hired for a variety of reasons with the most common being: 
 
 Assistance in the place of a regular employee who is absent for a specified period of time 
 Additional assistance during periods of abnormal or peak workloads 
 Assistance with special projects 
 Seasonal work 
 Emergencies 
 
 
If you are looking for an employment opportunity, TES is a great way to showcase your professional skills and assist Auburn University while gaining valuable work experience within higher education. 
 
 AU students are not eligible for  TES .
